Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html#/s:13Networ.name: authorization
Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html#/s:13Networ.abstract: The HTTP Authorization request header contains the credentials to authenticate a user agent with a server,

Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html#/s:13Networ.name: accept
Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html#/s:13Networ.abstract: The Accept request HTTP header advertises which content types, expressed as MIME types,

Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html#/s:13Networ.name: acceptEncoding
Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html#/s:13Networ.abstract: The Accept-Encoding request HTTP header advertises which content encoding, usually a compression algorithm,

Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html#/s:13Networ.name: contentType
Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html#/s:13Networ.abstract: The Content-Type entity header is used to indicate the media type of the resource.

Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html#/s:13Networ.name: userAgent
Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html#/s:13Networ.abstract: The User-Agent request header contains a characteristic string that allows the network protocol peers to identify

Structs/HTTP/Header/ContentType.html#/s:.name: multipartForm
Structs/HTTP/Header/ContentType.html#/s:.abstract: Marks the content as mutipart form data.

Structs/HTTP/Header/ContentType.html#/s:.name: json
Structs/HTTP/Header/ContentType.html#/s:.abstract: Marks the content as text that is in valid json format.

Structs/HTTP/Header/ContentType.html#/s:.name: xml
Structs/HTTP/Header/ContentType.html#/s:.abstract: Marks the content as text that is in valid xml format.

Structs/HTTP/Header.html#/s:13Networking.name: value
Structs/HTTP/Header.html#/s:13Networking.abstract: The value stored under this header key.

Structs/HTTP/Header.html#/s:13Networking.name: init(_:value:)
Structs/HTTP/Header.html#/s:13Networking.abstract: Creates a new HTTP.Header object with given values.

Structs/HTTP/Header/ContentType.html.name: ContentType
Structs/HTTP/Header/ContentType.html.abstract: Collection of most common values send under the Content-Type http header key.

Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html.name: Key
Structs/HTTP/Header/Key.html.abstract: Collection of commonly used http header keys.

Structs/HTTP/Method.html.name: Method
Structs/HTTP/Method.html.abstract: HTTP defines methods (sometimes referred to as verbs) to indicate the desired action to be performed on the identified resource.

Structs/HTTP/Header.html.name: Header
Structs/HTTP/Header.html.abstract: Container that represents a single key:value HTTP Header field.

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: scheme
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: The scheme describes the protocol that will be used to reach the desired resource over the network.

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: host
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: The network host we are trying to reach.

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: port
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: The port over which we want to reach the desired network resource.

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: path
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: The path component of the url, describing exactly which endpoint we want to reach of this host.

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: queryItems
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: Collection of name-value pairs from the query portion of a URL.

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: headers
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: Collection of containers that represent key:value HTTP Header fields.

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: method
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: The desired http method over which you want to talk with the desired network resource,

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: decodeResponse(_:)
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: The function whose purpose is to convert the server response data in to the ResponseDataType that you have passed.

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: init(completion:)
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: Invoke this initializer to call the Endpoint.

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: generatedRequest
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: Generates url request by combining all configurable properties.

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: handleResponse(data:urlResponse:error:completion:)
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: Handles the server response as received directly by the URLDataTask‘s completion block.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: scheme
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: The scheme describes the protocol that will be used to reach the desired resource over the network.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: host
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: The network host we are trying to reach.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: port
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: The port over which we want to reach the desired network resource.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: path
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: The path component of the url, describing exactly which endpoint we want to reach of this host.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: queryItems
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: Collection of name-value pairs from the query portion of a URL.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: headers
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: Collection of containers that represent key:value HTTP Header fields.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: method
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: The desired http method over which you want to talk with the desired network resource,

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: decodeResponse(_:)
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: The function whose purpose is to convert the server response data in to the ResponseDataType that you have passed.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: encodeRequest(_:)
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: The function whose purpose is to convert the request data of type RequestDataType into raw Data that will be set as http request body.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: init(withRequestData:completion:)
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: Invoke this initializer to call the Endpoint.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: generatedRequest
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: Generates url request by combining all configurable properties.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: handleResponse(data:urlResponse:error:completion:)
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: Handles the server response as received directly by the URLDataTask‘s completion block.

Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.name: failedToGenerateRequest
Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.abstract: Occurs when you have entered wrong url request data like host or path in wrong format.

Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.name: inputEncodingErrorOccured(_:)
Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.abstract: Occurs in endpoint that has requst data, when the conversion to raw Data of this request container fails.

Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.name: urlSessionErrorOccured(_:)
Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.abstract: Occurs when the Foundation network classes give errors back.

Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.name: unexpectedURLResponse(_:)
Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.abstract: Occurs when we receive URLResponse that is different than HTTPURLResponse.

Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.name: badStatusCode(_:)
Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.abstract: Occurs if the endpoint returns http status code that is not in 200..<400.

Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.name: noDataReturned
Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.abstract: Occurs when the endpoint does not give any response to work with.

Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.name: responseDecodingErrorOccured(_:)
Structs/Endpoint/Error.html#/s:13Network.abstract: Occurs when the data returned from the server can not be decoded correctly into the set ResponseType.

Structs/Endpoint/Error.html.name: Error
Structs/Endpoint/Error.html.abstract: All possible errors that can occur in regards to Endpoints.

Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.name: WithRequestAndResponseType
Structs/Endpoint/WithRequestAndResponseT.abstract: Endpoint that takes its generic parameter RequestDataType, encodes it to Data and sets it as http request body.

Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.name: WithResponseTypeOnly
Structs/Endpoint/WithResponseTypeOnly.ht.abstract: Endpoint that does not set http request body.

Structs/Endpoint.html.name: Endpoint
Structs/Endpoint.html.abstract: Group Containing All supported types of endpoints that NetworkingKit supports.

Structs/HTTP.html.name: HTTP
Structs/HTTP.html.abstract: Container holding constants and logic about common networking stuff.

Extensions/URL/Scheme.html#/s:10Foundati.name: https
Extensions/URL/Scheme.html#/s:10Foundati.abstract: HTTPS means Hyper Text Transfer Protocol Secure. Basically, it is the secure version of HTTP.

Extensions/URL/Scheme.html.name: Scheme
Extensions/URL/Scheme.html.abstract: The URI scheme identifies the protocol to be used to access the resource on the Internet. The most common are HTTP (without SSL) or HTTPS (with SSL).

Extensions/URLResponse.html#/s:So13NSURL.name: errorMessage
Extensions/URLResponse.html#/s:So13NSURL.abstract: Error message that is used when wrong kind or URLResponse is returned by the server.

Enums/TimePeriod.html#/s:13NetworkingKit.name: miliseconds(_:)
Enums/TimePeriod.html#/s:13NetworkingKit.abstract: Use that when you want to represent milliseconds.

Enums/TimePeriod.html#/s:13NetworkingKit.name: seconds(_:)
Enums/TimePeriod.html#/s:13NetworkingKit.abstract: Use that when you want to represent seconds.

Enums/TimePeriod.html#/s:13NetworkingKit.name: minutes(_:)
Enums/TimePeriod.html#/s:13NetworkingKit.abstract: Use that when you want to represent minutes.

Enums/TimePeriod.html#/s:13NetworkingKit.name: hours(_:)
Enums/TimePeriod.html#/s:13NetworkingKit.abstract: Use that when you want to represent hours.

Enums/TimePeriod.html#/s:13NetworkingKit.name: days(_:)
Enums/TimePeriod.html#/s:13NetworkingKit.abstract: Use that when you want to represent days.

Enums/TimePeriod.html.name: TimePeriod
Enums/TimePeriod.html.abstract: Enum that stores time in humanly readable formats and it is capable of producing TimeInterval.
